article.para: This documentation describes how to install an Ulteo Open Virtual Desktop Application Server on a Microsoft Windows server system.
This documention does not describe the Open Virtual Desktop installation or configuration. For that, please read the Installation documentation.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para:
The supported operating systems are:
Microsoft Windows Server 2003 x86/x64
Microsoft Windows Server 2008 x86/x64
You also have Terminal services(2003) or Remote Desktop services(2008) installed and configured. Members of the Remote Desktop users group have to be authorize to start a TS session.
An Ulteo OVD Session Manager installed and configured.
The Ulteo OVD ApS setup. It can be download from .

section.title: Installation of the Application Server
section.para: Copy the setup setup on the Windows machine.

screenshot.screeninfo: put the installer on the desktop

section.para: The only question is about the host/IP address where the session manager can be accessed. (we use here for the example, but of course, you have to set your own domain name).
Finish the installation. The Windows agent should be configured and running.

simplesect.title: Session Manager side
simplesect.para: Your Windows server should appear among the Unregistered servers.
If your server does not show up in the list, you might have a DNS configuration issue, or the Windows agent has a bug. Please refer to .

section.title: Register the server and publish some applications
section.para: First, register your Windows server and switch it from "maintenance" to "production" mode.
You should be able to list applications that are installed on your Windows server.

The next step is to add some Windows applications to an existing Application Group so that users get authorized to run those your Windows applications. If you don't have an existing application group please refer to the Ulteo Open Virtual Desktop Publication documentation first.

section.title: Lauch a session
section.para: If you launch a session, you should be able to access to your Windows applications from the application menu and from desktop icons if you enabled that option in the administration console.

simplesect.title: Have a look at the Windows agent log
simplesect.para: In a default Windows installation, the log file can be found at C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data\Ulteo\ovd\main.log.
It's also possible to read some debug messages in the Windows Event Viewer (on the Appplication section).
